DOC.brief_summary: Low-volume high-intensity interval exercise training may improve aspect health fitness young people , intervention must practical engaging . The investigator examine effect novel school-based low-volume high-intensity interval train programme health , fitness physical activity outcomes adolescent school pupil . 101 English adolescent age 13-14 year take part study . Participants healthy male female volunteer , recruit four school Northeast England . Using non-randomised design , two school take part intervention , two assign control . Those intervention group complete 10-week school-based high-intensity interval exercise training programme . The intervention take place three time per week , comprise 4-7 repetition 45 maximal effort exercise ( boxing , dance , soccer basketball drill ) , intersperse 90-s rest . Participants encourage work maximally 45-s repetition . Control participant instruct change lifestyle , dietary physical activity habit intervention period , maintain normal school physical education routine . Study outcomes blood lipid glucose level , body composition , cardiorespiratory fitness , carotid intima-media thickness , physical activity level , serum C-reactive protein level blood pressure .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Novel High-intensity Interval Training Health Fitness Outcomes English Adolescents
DOC.criteria: 1 . Must attend one four school study take place 2 . Must Year 9 English school year ( aged 1315 year ) 3 . Must provide parental consent participant assent 4 . Must free exclusion criterion 1 . Symptoms know presence heart disease major atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease 2 . Condition injury comorbidity affect ability undertake exercise 3 . Diabetes mellitus 4 . Early family history sudden cardiac death 5 . Condition disorder communicable via blood 6 . Pregnancy likelihood pregnancy
